intro: Acosta muretii, commonly known as the Muretii acosta, is a flowering plant native to South America, particularly found in regions of Argentina and Chile. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton plants. The plant is characterized by its hairy stems and heart-shaped leaves, with small, pale yellow flowers that bloom in summer. It thrives in dry, rocky environments and is often found in coastal areas. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare species with specific ecological requirements.
